content.description: A container is filled with a monatomic ideal gas. The top of the container has two cylindrical stoppers that are each secured in place and in contact with the gas. Stopper <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has diameter <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> and Stopper <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"> <mn>2</mn> </math> has diameter <math alttext="the fraction D over 2" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>, as shown. The magnitude of the force exerted on Stopper <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> by the gas is <math alttext="F sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>.
content.question: What is the magnitude of the force exerted on Stopper <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"> <mn>2</mn> </math> by the gas?

topic.text: 9.1: Kinetic Theory of Temperature and Pressure

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
